title: Loliware scores $15.4m to replace single-use plastics with seaweed-based materials - AgFunderNews
summary: Loliware is developing seaweed-based alternatives to single-use plastics, specifically straws, which offer a sustainable solution that captures carbon and supports ocean health. Their mission includes creating inclusive solutions for those who need straws and demonstrating that seaweed products can compete with traditional plastics.

title: Volvo CE launches electric loader conversion - electrive.com - www.electrive.com
summary: Volvo Construction Equipment (Volvo CE) has developed a new electric conversion solution for mid-size construction machinery, specifically a 20-ton loader, as part of its commitment to carbon neutrality by 2040 and a 35% electric vehicle share by 2030. The company emphasizes the necessity of both retrofit and dedicated electric solutions to achieve decarbonization goals in the construction industry.

title: Bridgestone India to invest INR 600 crore for expansion - ETAuto
summary: Bridgestone India is investing over INR 600 crores to upgrade technology and capacity at its Chakan plant in Pune to meet the increasing demand for quality passenger tyres. This investment, amounting to EUR 70 million, will incorporate global technologies that focus on fuel-efficient tyre production and sustainable practices, including a solar power plant and a carbon-neutral biomass fuel-based boiler. The company aims to provide superior mobility solutions with products like the 'Sturdo' tyre that offers a longer lifespan and the Ecopia tyres designed to enhance fuel efficiency and reduce carbon emissions.

title: Renault, Nissan set to invest Rs 5,300 crore in Tamil Nadu, launch 6 new vehicles - The Times of India
summary: Renault and Nissan have announced a ₹5,300 crore ($600 million) investment in Tamil Nadu to develop six new vehicles, including four C-segment SUVs and two A-segment electric vehicles. This investment aims to modernize their Oragadam plant, increasing capacity utilization from 47% to 80% and creating around 2,000 new jobs. The Alliance also plans to make the factory carbon-neutral through a significant increase in renewable energy. The new models will target both domestic and export markets, highlighting the importance of the Indian automotive sector.
